content.description: This one offers some legitimate in-your-face crack climbing. Bomber jams lead to awkward squeeze moves and technical stemming up high.
content.protection: A smaller crack in the back and some solid chockstones facilitate reasonable protection. Bolted Anchor.

content.description: This route features power-endurance climbing at its finest.  Probably only 40 feet of hard climbing, but every single move will push you. Boulder the start to the route's only jug and clip the 2nd bolt from a decent hold above it. Slap your way up the slopey rail until you can quickly fire in some gear from a poor hold and pull a final boulder problem to a horizontal rail.   Mantle the rail and summit the cliff on easier terrain to find an anchor. Fun, pumpy, and unique for the region.
content.protection: 2 bolts, cams (fingers to hands), Bolted Anchor.  Shorter folks might like to pre-hang a draw on the 2nd bolt.  Also nice to anchor the belayer into something while the leader is gunning for the gear placements out the rail.  This thing will feel sporty until you take the falls a few times.
content.location: Obvious arete in middle of crag

content.description: Follow angling jug rails and cool pockets up and left to the anchor on Cosmic Charlie.  Great rock, would be sweet if it were taller.
content.protection: Bring a #3 and #4 Camalot and a light rack.

climbs.name: The Landing Strip
climbs.fa: Ben Sachs, Christian Drum, Stuart Turner, 2009.

content.description: This route combines arête and face climbing with some cool technical stemming.  Pull a hard boulder problem on the arête. After reaching the huge jug, angle right across the face past 2 more bolts and some fun, sequential climbing to a stemmed-out stance on The Wormhole.  Engineer your way up the now very wide (buy easy) flared chimney using some face holds also. Bring a stopper for the last bit shared with The Wormhole. A sustained route with good flow.
content.protection: Pretty much a sport route.  3 bolts, 1 stopper (#10 works well). Bolted Anchor
content.location: Climbs the bolted face left of the obvious wide crack.

content.description: Short gear route in the access gully.  Good quality rock, short crux section.  Not on the topo.
content.protection: light rack, tree anchor.  Walk off the top

content.description: Climb past the bolt, pull the roof bulge slightly left, and mantle to reach the anchor.
content.location: This route starts from the small boulder on the right end of the main wall, 15 right of Close Encounters.

content.description: Start in a large flake below a bolt. Follow cool flakes and jugs to an exciting section up high. The first route established here, and a good warm-up.
content.location: This is the only route on the rock fin 60 left of the main wall.

content.description: Fierce crimping leads to an exciting crux section. Technical and dynamic. A 40' boulder problem.
content.location: The obvious sport route up the middle of the steep face.
